body.name: Sakugi Dish Drying Rack for Countertop - Rustproof Space-Saving & Multipurpose 2-Tier Dish Rack for Kitchen Counter with Utensil Holder, Large-Capacity, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 14 hrs 38 mins
FREE pickup Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35

features: 2-TIER LARGE CAPACITY: With a practical 2-tier design and a size of 16.6*10.2*16.1 inch, Sakugi dish drainer for kitchen counter enables you to store different types and sizes of kitchenware, such as bowls, dishes, knives, wine glasses, kitchen pots, and frying pans. This 2-tier dish drying rack is perfect for families of 3-4 persons.

RUSTPROOF MATERIAL: Sakugi kitchen dish drying rack is made of premium stainless steel, which is durable enough for long-term use and will not rust or deform. Sakugi stainless steel dish drying rack keeps your countertop clean and organized all the time. (Note: Make sure the height between the countertop and cabinet is higher than 23.6 inch to fit into the rack.)

MULTIPURPOSE DISH RACK: Sakugi multifunctional dish drying rack with drainboard comes with multiple accessories, including 2 baskets, a cutting board holder, and a cutlery holder. They can efficiently help you to store diverse kitchenware. Sakugi dishes drying rack can meet all your needs for storing and drying kitchenware.

EASY TO INSTALL & CLEAN: Sakugi dish drainer is easy to install with the attached installation manual and accessories. In addition, with the waterproof black coating, the rack is also easy to clean. All you need to do is wipe the rack with a damp cloth or rinse it under a running tap after use.

EFFECTIVE DRAINAGE: Sakugi kitchen dish drying rack features an automatic drainage system that consists of a drainboard and a water outlet. It can drain excess water into the sink effectively and automatically. Moreover, the rotatable water outlet enables you to adjust the direction according to the position of your sink.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 2,114 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #812 in Kitchen & Dining (See Top 100 in Kitchen & Dining) #11 in Dish Racks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for small nyc kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to save space and because of the tiered design. Others are bulky but this one is delicate while being sturdy. Easy to assemble!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is small but very nice
reviews.reviewText: Building our cabin and using the kitchen unit my boyfriend yanked out of the travel trailer. The rack is sturdy and very nice looking. We can't have many dishes and I needed something that would hold the clean dishes as well until we build cabinets and everything. It's perfect.Anyone who lowers stars based on basic dimensions that are clearly stated needs to invest in a tape measure. Luckily the bad reviews about how it must be made for a trailer or a dorm assured me it would be great. Also a tape measure confirmed that before I purchased it.Sorry for the mess in the pic. It's a cabin in progress.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This drying rack is great, but it is not meant for small spaces. I cannot put plates on the upper drying rack because it is too tall and hits the bottom of my upper cabinets.However, I pulled the drying rack out just a bit and it works great that way.Assembly was very confusing, in my opinion. Once you do get it assembled and get it placed in a spot that works, it is great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this item
reviews.reviewText: I love this item. it makes doing dishes so much easier. I like the design, water drips in the sink now, as it should. my previous one spilled water on counter constantly. I also like that you have option to spill water on one of the 3 sides. the top rack is live saver.Not much to say here. stores lot of dishes and keeps the counter dry by dumping water in sink properly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought as Gift
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a gift for my father (his request), and it does a great job, is sturdy, and easy to assemble, I'm not entirely sure if it's great for small spaces. The two tiers and side rack means it can hold more dishes, but that also means it's a bit awkward as you can't just simply slide it back on a counter if there's a cabinet above it, aside from that though he is enjoying the dish rack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought the X-Large. it's still fine for small places and works ok. My only complaints are the tray that collects water could be a little more inclined or slanted down because normal drops of water from the plates stay on the tray instead going towards the drain. The other issue the spout that emits out into he sink is too short. Third problem but not a major problem is that the second tier rack for plates it a little wobbly and super sturdy. If they fixed those 3 things it would be perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fits all my plates and bowls on top and even larger/taller items on the bottom. I always had to turn my nutribullet tall cup on its side. I can easier turn it up side down and get it thoroughly dried. Same with tall cheese graters, and tumblers. The only thing that sucks is the utensil holder. It hold very few items, the side does hold additional knives but not well. The hooks work but only for smaller utensils like mini tongs/spatula.The cutting board rack works to hang however it shifts easily and since it's on my counter all the water from it just goes on there too.Overall though for $20 it works super well, and looks 10x better than all the other stainless steel/plastic ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great dish strainer
reviews.reviewText: It hold a lot of dishes and is very stable. I love that it sits up off my counter and therefore no mold under my strainer like I used to get. Only thing I don't like, is that the two addition racks on each end are easily bumped off. I was able to fix that with zip ties. So, no major problems. I let my bf pick this rack out and he is so happy with it that he actually does dishes sometimes. It's a win all the way around!
